game
Class Movable_Object

java.lang.Object
  game.Movable_Object
All Implemented Interfaces:
Item
public class Movable_Object
extends java.lang.Object
implements Item

Author:
JÃ¸rgen Nordmoen

This is the base class for which all movable objects in the game will inherit from, it has some basic method, which include the collision detection, painting it self and moving.

The class it self inherits from Item to insure that all objects in the game can do collision detection and paint them self

See Also:
Static_Object, Item

Constructor Detail

Movable_Object

public Movable_Object(int x,
                      int y,
                      java.awt.Shape shape,
                      java.awt.Color color)
Creates the movable object with it's position and it's shape. This method also sets the various different other parameters of this object to a default value

Parameters:
x - Sets the position of this object to x
y - Sets the position of this object to y
shape - Sets this objects shape to shape
color - Sets this objects colour, this means that this object does not have an image but rather filled with one colour

Movable_Object

public Movable_Object(int x,
                      int y,
                      java.awt.Shape shape,
                      java.awt.Image image)
Creates the movable object with it's position and it's shape. This method also sets the various different other parameters of this object to a default value

Parameters:
x - Sets the position of this object to x
y - Sets the position of this object to y
shape - Sets this objects shape to shape
image - Sets this objects image which is used to represent it self on screen, this is only used in the paint method and a shape must still be specified
Method Detail

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
This method draws this object either using it's colour or using the Image of the object. It first translates the Graphics so it can start drawing from it's top left corner. When it is done it discards the Graphics object**Should it discard? Needs testing!**

Specified by:
draw in interface Item
Parameters:
g - the graphics which the object will use to draw with

hitbox

public boolean hitbox(java.awt.Shape s)
Checks if this object intersects with the current parameter and returns the result

Specified by:
hitbox in interface Item
Parameters:
s - a shape to see if they hit
Returns:
a boolean, true if they hit, false other wise

move

public void move(int ddx,
                 int ddy)
This method updates the speed in both directions. Contrary to it's name this method does not move the object it self, but rather it updates it's speed, to move the object use updateX() or updateY()

Parameters:
ddx - the acceleration to the speed in the x direction
ddy - the acceleration to the speed in the y direction

updateX

public void updateX()
This method moves the object in the x direction, by just adding the current speed to the position

updateY

public void updateY()
This method moves the object in the y direction, by just adding the current speed to the position
